projects.title: Desktop Robot Arm
projects.summary: A 4-DOF robot arm built from scratch using NEMA 17 stepper motors and an Arduino Uno with CNC shield control. Each joint uses a different gearbox architecture to study mechanical power transmission.

sections.overview: Each joint uses a distinct gearbox design (spur gear planetary, cycloidal, and cycloidal planetary). The system is controlled by user-specified joint angles via the Arduino IDE serial monitor.
sections.build: Version 1 used a 25:1 spur gear planetary (Joint 1), 20:1 cycloidal (Joint 2), and 10:1 cycloidal planetary (Joint 3). Version 2 upgraded Joint 2 to a 100:1 cycloidal planetary gearbox to address backlash and precision issues.
sections.design: Gearbox design philosophy compared spur gear planetary, cycloidal drive, and cycloidal planetary architectures. Cycloidal tooth profiles provide near-zero backlash through continuous rolling contact and high tooth overlap.
sections.results: Successfully designed, manufactured, and integrated four distinct gearbox architectures in a single robotic system.

projects.title: Humanoid Torso
projects.summary: A modular humanoid torso designed for expansion with electronics storage, a rigid aluminum extrusion frame, and a low-friction rotation base.

sections.overview: A modular torso system designed for continuous expansion and adaptability, enabling storage for electronics while maintaining structural integrity.
sections.build: Expandable MDF storage boards for electronics, an aluminum extrusion frame with T-nuts for adjustable sizing, and a PLA case assembled with wood filler and paint for a clean finish.
sections.design: A rotation mechanism combines a lazy Susan bearing with a custom gear system driven by a Dynamixel motor for precise motion.
sections.results: Demonstrated a modular architecture that supports future expansion without redesign.

projects.title: Humanoid Head Mechanism
projects.summary: A differential head control mechanism that achieves two degrees of freedom with only two motors using clever gearing.

sections.overview: Inspired by wrist differential mechanisms, this head control system achieves nod and spin using two motors.
sections.build: Designed in Fusion 360, rapidly prototyped via 3D printing, and controlled using Python.
sections.design: Opposite motor rotation results in nodding; same direction rotation results in spinning. 2:1 gear ratio with 360° rotation range.
sections.results: Demonstrated 2-DOF motion with a compact differential mechanism.

projects.title: Aluminium Cans to Sapphire
projects.summary: A science-fair project that launched the engineering journey: transforming aluminum cans into aluminum oxide crystals and ruby through a multi-step process.

sections.overview: Inspired by a friend's joke about turning aluminum cans into ruby, this project won science fair awards and became the start of an engineering journey.
sections.build: Step 1: collect and melt aluminum cans to obtain pure aluminum. Step 2: convert to aluminum chloride using HCl, then to aluminum hydroxide and aluminum oxide. Step 3: add chromium oxide to produce ruby; an alternate route produced sapphire.
sections.design: Route 2 was developed to avoid chlorine gas from Route 1. Safety note in the original project: no injuries occurred.
sections.results: Produced orange crystal (iron impurities) and ruby (fluorescent under UV).
